intro: Eucalyptus longissima, commonly known as the long-leaved mallees, is a species of eucalyptus native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, multi-stemmed shrub form and long, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hair. The plant produces small, globular flower clusters that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in spring. Its bark is smooth and peels in thin strips, and it is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests. Eucalyptus longissima is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
